title: ARBITRATION OVER A PARALLEL ROAD: EXPROPRIATION BY NORTH TORONTO OF MOUNT PLEASANT CEMETERY LAND
description: The article highlights the arbitration between P. H. Drayton, K.C and Mr. C. H. Ritchie, K.C, solicitor for the Cemetery Trust. Provides insight into community involvment in the creation of the road and opinions of the mayor of Toronto A. J. Brown.
creator: The Globe
subject: History; Mount Pleasant Road

title: The City of the Dead: A Visit to Mount Pleasant Cemetery
description: The article was published on July 13, 1889 and gives insight and opinions on what a person will feel like well walking around the cemetery
creator: The Globe
subject: History; Greenspace

title: Popular place: Mepham Garden, near the cemetery office, attracts cyclists, joggers and those seeking solitude
description: Photograph is from a August 24, 1986 Toronto Star publication titled "The cemetery designed for the living, Mount Pleasant offers visitors green space and a lesson in history".
creator: Bock, Tony
subject: Nature; Greenspace

title: Garden's tale a flowering of the spirit
creator: Toronto Daily Star
subject: Newspaper; History

title: North Toronto Gets Road Through Cemetery: Construction, Now Long Delayed, Will Go on at Once
description: Article is the announcement to the start of construction for the road. Highlights the cost of the road would be around $15,000 of which the town of North Toronto would pay $2000, well York township and General Burying Ground Trust (Mount Pleasant Group) would pay the rest.
creator: The Globe
subject: History; Mount Pleasant Road

title: The Pond, Mount Pleasant Cemetery
description: Colour postcard of a pond surrounded by trees. The caption on the top front states, "The Pond, Mount Pleasant Cemetery, Toronto, Canada." The back of the postcard has a hand-written note on it with postmark dated August 2, 1912.
creator: Valentine & Sons
subject: Nature; History

title: Mount Pleasant-Cemetery-Toronto
description: Black and white postcard of a funeral home or mausoleum surrounded by trees. The caption on the bottom front states, "Mount Pleasant  - Cemetery - Toronto" . A red ensign (with the British Union Jack) flag is printed in the top right corner. The back of the postcard has a hand-written note on it with postmark dated September 15, 1903.
creator: Galbraith Photo Co.
subject: History

title: Sunday Resorts: Rambles on the Island and in the Parks. The Visitors to the Cemeteries
description: An article from the Globe and Mail from a June 26, 1882 publication. A section of it highlights the cemetery as a nice place to walk around on Sundays and it's natural beauty of it.
creator: The Globe
subject: History; Newspaper; Greenspace

title: Mount Pleasant Cemetery, Toronto, Ontario
description: Black and white photo of the Pond in Mount Pleasant Cemetery

title: ROAD THROUGH CEMETERY: PEOPLE NORTH OF MOUNT PLEASANT ASKING FOR IT A Conference Was Held Yesterday Between the Different Parties Interested, but Nothing of a Definite Nature Resulted From it
description: An article from the Globe and Mail from a June 9, 1908 publication. The article is about the people of Toronto who lived north of the cemetery as they requested to the Ontarian Legislature to build a public road through the cemetery.
creator: The Globe
subject: Mount Pleasant Road; History

title: Rt. Hon. William Lyon MacKenzie King, 1874 - 1950 Mount Pleasant Cemetery, Toronto, Ontario
description: The grave of Canada's tenth Prime Minister, William Lyon Mackenzie King. He was the Prime Minister of Canada from 1921-1930 and again from 1935-1948. He is currently the only Prime Minister buried in  Mount Pleasant Cemetery
creator: Stuparyk, Michael
subject: Notable People

title: Vast Throng Mourns Mr. King
description: The front page publication of the Toronto Star on July, 27 1950. Front page announces the death and burial of Prime Minister William Lyon Mackenzie King
creator: Toronto Daily Star
subject: Notable People

title: Garden of Remebrance
description: Photograph of the Garden of Remebrance
creator: A.R. English
subject: Green Space; Nature

title: When he was seven James Joseph Muir's father, Alexander Muir, wrote Canada's national song
description: Photograph orginate's from a Toronto Star publication that shows James Muir, the son of Alexander Muir, who wrote Canada's national song "The Maple Leaf Forever".
creator: Unknown
subject: Notable People

title: OPENING OF MOUNT PLEASANT CEMETERY: A QUIET RESTING PLACE FOR THE PEOPLE'S DEAD THE TRUSTEES REPORT
description: A publication of "The Globe" that announces the grand opening of Mount Pleasant Cemetery. It highlights the notable aspects of the cemetery, the history that led to the opening of Mount Pleasant Cemetery by the General Burying Ground Trust (Mount Pleasant Group) and the financing of it.
creator: The Globe
subject: History: Greenspace

title: The Children's Memorial Graden
description: The Garden initially started off as an unofficial monument by Mary Smith who's baby was was buried in a unmarked grave in a remote section of the cemetery, deserved for stillborn and children without parents.The site became dedicated in 1992 and features numerous native plants.
creator: Jacob Da Silva
subject: Nature; Greenspace
